title: Vrindavan
summary: Vrindavan (pronunciation ; IAST: Vṛndāvana), also spelt Vrindaban and Brindaban,[2] is a historical city in the Mathura district of Uttar Pradesh, India. It is one of the most sacred places in Vaishnavism.[3][4] It is located in the Braj Bhoomi region, and is where, according to Hinduism, Krishna spent most of his childhood days.[3][5] The city is about 11 km from Mathura, Krishna's birthplace on the Agra–Delhi National Highway as NH-44.[6][7] The town hosts many temples dedicated to the worship of Radha and Krishna.[4]
